definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
phonetic component in certain characters with sound huò, such as 護, 獲, 穫 and 擭
knife, saw and cauldron/ancient instruments of torture/fig. torture
battle-ax and boiling cauldron (idiom); facing torture and execution

sentences.english: Heat wok with oil, deep-fry drumsticks until golden, dish up and drain excess oil, set aside.
sentences.chinese: 燒熱油鑊，下雞槌炸至金黃，盛起隔油備用。

sentences.english: Cover the wok, and braise for 10 minutes over medium low heat until the potatoes are quite tender.
sentences.chinese: 蓋上鑊蓋，以中低火燜10分鐘直至薯仔較腍身。

sentences.english: Heat wok with oil, put in chicken wings and fry until golden.
sentences.chinese: 燒熱油鑊，放入雞翼煎至金黃。

sentences.english: Fry beef tenderloin in wok over medium heat until well done.
sentences.chinese: 將牛柳落鑊，用中火煎至熟透。

sentences.english: Steam the glutinous rice in a wok or steamer.
sentences.chinese: 將糯米放在鑊或蒸籠上蒸熟。

sentences.english: Rinse pork belly, rub skin with dark soya sauce, sear skin until brown.
sentences.chinese: 五花腩原件衝淨，用老抽搽抹豬皮，用白鑊爆至啡色。

sentences.english: Add 1tbsp olive oil into the pan, add risotto and briefly fry for 30secs.
sentences.chinese: 下1湯匙橄欖油至鑊中，加入意大利米略炒30秒。

sentences.english: Wash mature duck and wipe dry. Stir fry Sichuan peppercorns and coarse salt in a dry wok until fragrant.
sentences.chinese: 光鴨洗淨，抹乾水份﹔花椒粒與粗鹽用白鑊粉香。

sentences.english: Around the world in 4 steps with Wok-it.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的4個步驟與鑊事。

sentences.english: Put back the chicken and sauté it, until the chicken has the sauce soaked. Dish up and serve.
sentences.chinese: 把雞肉回鑊快手炒勻，待芡汁滲透雞髀肉，即可上碟。

sentences.english: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in wok, stir fry all the vegetables with seasonings.
sentences.chinese: 鑊內燒油1湯匙，加入所有材料與調味料炒勻，上碟。

sentences.english: Heat 3 tbsp garlic oil in wok, shallow-fry the beef fillet until 70%done. Remove.
sentences.chinese: 鑊內燒3湯匙蒜片油，把牛柳煎至七成熟，取出。

sentences.english: Cover with the lid and cook over high heat.
Heat up some oil in the wok, saut? the beef until medium rare, dish up and leave aside.
sentences.chinese: 起油鑊，將醃好的牛肉加入炒至七分熟，盛起。

sentences.english: Heat a clean wok. Add all the tea leaves and stir well.
sentences.chinese: 燒熱白鑊，加入所有茶葉，拌勻。

sentences.english: In a hot skillet pan-fry the tiger prawns. Add salt and pepper to taste.
sentences.chinese: 熱鑊下油把虎蝦炒熟，並以鹽及黑胡椒調味。

definition: to cook in a covered vessel/to casserole/to stew
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
to clasp under the arm/to coerce
to stew in soy sauce and spices
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
